description.narrative: By end of 2021, adolescent programming is strengthened and integrated in education, health, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), child protection through the operationalization of adolescent programming strategy., which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnerships for social and behaviour change
Behavioural change communication campaigns on gender equitable roles and practices
Capacity Development for frontline workers on gender equality
Capacity and Skills Development for social and behaviour change
Community engagement, feedback and accountability mechanisms
SBC system strengthening, strategy development, planning and coordination including preparedness and response in Humanitarian Action
Technical assistance - Gender discriminatory roles and practices

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Afghanistan Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015 to 2019 Extended until 2/2023 (see extensions 1 to 3)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015 to 2019 Results Matrix
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Afghanistan 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2021, adolescent programming is strengthened and integrated in education, health, nutrition and WASH, child protectionthrough the operationalization of adolescent programming strategy.

description.narrative: Strategic guidance, tools and coordination was provided in the design of the new CPD to ensure the development of a programme that is relevant to the context with a focus on the humanitarian, development, and peace nexus. The office maintained strong collaboration with other UN agencies in the country and ensured strong participation in the UNCT activities. The officeestablished 22 new partnerships with implementing partners and strengthened its engagement with the donor partners thus raisingUS$ 672m against the total budget of US$448m with an additional US$200 in firm pipeline, and US$778m in soft pipeline.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
